pullRequest.body:
A new file with results about the absolute continuity of the composition of measures and kernels which use an assumption `CountableOrCountablyGenerated Î± Î²` on the measurable spaces.

From the TestingLowerBounds project.
Co-authored-by: Lorenzo Luccioli

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [834acedf17](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/21902/commits/834acedf17ceb51d14459a09b1c7b9eb7a623681)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Probability.Kernel.Composition.AbsolutelyContinuous` (new file)|2076|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ AbsolutelyContinuous.kernel_of_compProd`
`+ MutuallySingular.compProd_of_right`
`+ MutuallySingular.compProd_of_right'`
`+ absolutelyContinuous_compProd_iff'`
`+ absolutelyContinuous_compProd_right_iff`
`+ compProd_apply_prod`
`+ compProd_apply_univ`
`+ mutuallySingular_compProd_right_iff`
`++ compProd_eq_zero_iff`
`+-+ compProd_congr`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

Thanks!
maintainer merge
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by EtienneC30.
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13419583917/job/37488742822)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13419583917/job/37488742456)
That's great! Just a few minor remarks.

You can also `rwa` if you want.
```suggestion
    rwa [h_eq, â† Kernel.withDensity_rnDeriv_eq_zero_iff_measure_eq_zero Îº Î· a,
      Kernel.withDensity_rnDeriv_eq_zero_iff_mutuallySingular]
```

Maybe it's worth adding the following lemma, what do you think?
```lean
lemma compProd_eq_zero_iff [SFinite Î¼] : Î¼ âŠ—â‚˜ Îº = 0 â†” âˆ€áµ a âˆ‚Î¼, Îº a = 0
```

I added that lemma, thanks! I also added a version of it for two kernels, which led to some refactoring in the files about composition-product of kernels and measures. I hope that's ok if that refactor stays part of this PR.
No problem!

Here you can also do this:
```suggestion
  by_cases ha : a âˆˆ s <;> simp [ha]
```

You can save a line in the statement, as you prefer.
```suggestion
    [IsSFiniteKernel Î·] [IsSFiniteKernel Î·'] (h : âˆ€ a, âˆ€áµ b âˆ‚(Îº a), Î· (a, b) = Î·' (a, b)) :
```

Is it okay if you put the hypothesis `h` on the first line? Personally when possible I prefer to leave the statement on its own line to make it easier to read.
```suggestion
lemma compProd_congr [IsSFiniteKernel Îº] [IsSFiniteKernel Î·] (h : Îº =áµ[Î¼] Î·) :
    Î¼ âŠ—â‚˜ Îº = Î¼ âŠ—â‚˜ Î· := by
```

Is it okay not to skip a line between one liners? Feel free to ignore this if it is.
```suggestion
@[simp] lemma compProd_zero_left (Îº : Kernel Î± Î²) : (0 : Measure Î±) âŠ—â‚˜ Îº = 0 := by simp [compProd]

@[simp] lemma compProd_zero_right (Î¼ : Measure Î±) : Î¼ âŠ—â‚˜ (0 : Kernel Î± Î²) = 0 := by simp [compProd]
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: absolute continuity results for composition of measures and kernels
